content: funfetti copyright © general hogbuffer 2021 for a stranded design this is about as simple as it gets - just alternating 1/1 between colours the design depends purely on the distribution of the different yarns i wanted to create a multi coloured stripe by using only 4 shades a bit like a cmyk profile on a compter graphic program size since the repeat is only 2 sts wide it will work for any size sock providing the overall st count is an even number i am giving examples for 64 72 and 80 sts but any other dimensions can easily be calculated the chart consists of a set of 4 transition parts going from one solid colour to another over 24 row after working all 4 transition charts a b c and d you are back with the colour you started with and it will repeat from there as with most stranded sock designs this is really just a plain stocking st sock but bear in mind that stranded knitting can not only have an effect on your gauge it will also produce a fabric that has a lot less stretch than regular stocking st so it cannot take as much negative ease as a plain regular sock while with most sock yarns i would be comfortable to knit myself a 64 st sock on 2 5 mm needles i will need 72 sts in stranded knitting and i will knit most yarns with a 2 75 mm needle so keep this in mind when selecting your size material 4 ply / fingering / sock yarn in 4 different colours overall totals will always depend on the size of the sock but to have 25 gr in each colour should be enough for all but the biggest size socks for this reason they are a good option for leftovers especially if you don t need / want to make identical socks while many stranded designs can look very charming when worked in variegated or tonally shaded yarns for this particular effect i would very much suggest you stick with totally solid yarns and make sure they are all 4 in very good contrast to each other needle size 2 5mm / 2 75 mm needles to give you the fabric drape you like as i said you may need to go up a size for stranded colour work this design can equally be knit on circulars or dpn s use what you are most comfortable with and what works best for you the instructions will assume that you are working on either two circular needles or magic loop further requirements tapestry needle stitch markers although you could do it without if they irritate you funfetti page 2 cuff with your first yarn colour and the smaller needle size cast on 64/72/80 sts close to a round taking care not to twist the sts work k1tbl p1 rib for as many rounds as you would like your cuff to be i
